poem:
### Morning Observance

whispers of commerce
spill from my hand—
a vessel promised 
to cradle warmth,
seeps instead
the cold drip of profit
holding tight fists
of fleeting moments

in this dance with the daily,
sweet ritual
cedes to brass tacks 

where is the art
in a leaking cup,
the promise
to hold what's sacred?
